text: Short-term Treasury yields {d}are {d}near 5% {d}the yield curve is steep {d}as Fed {d}rate increases {d}are anticipated.
The curve flattens, and {d}when inverts as 10-year yields {d}stop rising, signaling that investors {d}anticipate a slower pace of {d}economic growth and rate increases.
The Fed begins to cut rates {d}as the financial crisis spreads.
Fed announces a quantitative-easing {d}program, QE1, in which it plans to {d}buy {d}1000 billion in {d}mortgage-related bonds.
Fed expands QE1, adds Treasury, {d}{d}days at sees low rates {d}for {d}extended period.
Fed announces QE2, a new {d}bond-buying stimulus program.
The Fed says it will 'maintain' {d}{d}low rates through mid-2015.
The Fed ends Operation Twist {d}{d}and expands QE3.
Then U.S. Fed Chairman Bernanke {d}{d}says Fed could taper bond buys {d}{d}in the {d}next few meetings.
Fed takes the plunge {d}{d}announces that it will trim {d}{d}bond purchases.
The level of nonfarm employment {d}passes its prerecession peak.
The Fed announces end of QE3.
The central bank says {d}{d}it will be patient before {d}{d}raising rates.
Fed says it will raise rates {d}{d}when it is confident inflation {d}{d}will rise.
The Fed keeps rates {d}on hold {d}at its September meeting.
